https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A multidisciplinary field that combines geoscience with advanced mathematical modelling, simulation, numerical modelling, visualization and data analysis techniques. Computational geoscience uses large-scale, nonlinear models that couple multiple physical, chemical, and biological processes across various length and time scales to improve our understanding of the Earth system and its complexities, addressing geoscience grand challenges, and providing decision-support tools for geoscience policy makers and industry. The emergence of computation as a powerful tool for prediction and decision-making in the geosciences is driven by advances in the rapid expansion of our ability to instrument and observe the Earth, sustained improvements in computational models and solution methods for complex geoscience systems, and the relentless growth in computing power.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from adapted from:
1) https://link.springer.com/journal/10596
2) https://cse.umn.edu/esci/computational-geoscience.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#pref.@value: computational modelling and simulation in earth sciences

https://prez.dev/label.@value: computational modelling and simulation in earth sciences
